snippet: Some corporate executives and Republicans have found themselves on opposite sides in the fiscal crisis debate.
abstract: Congressional Republicans have largely rejected pleas from corporate chiefs calling for higher taxes and an end to threats over raising the nation's debt limit; effort, aimed at preventing further damage to the economy, was made at the behest of the Obama administration.
lead_paragraph: Some corporate executives and Republicans have found themselves on opposite sides in the fiscal crisis debate.

headline.seo: A Shift for G.O.P. as ‘Party of Business’
headline.main: For ‘Party of Business,’ Allegiances Are Shifting
headline.print_headline: For ‘Party of Business,’ Allegiances Are Shifting
